_instructions: Copy this to config.json and adjust values as needed

simulation._duration_days_help: Number of days to simulate (30 = 1 month, 90 = 3 months)
simulation._time_step_minutes_help: Simulation time step in minutes (15, 30, or 60 recommended)
simulation._start_date_help: Starting date (YYYY-MM-DD). Affects sun angle and daylight hours
simulation._season_help: Season for cloud coverage patterns: spring, summer, fall, winter
simulation._random_seed_help: Integer for reproducible results. Set to null for random behavior each run. Example: 519425893

battery._unit_capacity_kwh_help: Capacity per battery unit in kWh (13.5 = Tesla Powerwall)
battery._count_help: Number of battery units. Total capacity = unit_capacity_kwh × count
battery._min_soc_help: Minimum state of charge as decimal (0.05 = 5%, 0.1 = 10%). Protects against deep discharge

solar._unit_peak_power_kw_help: Peak power per solar array in kW (5.0 kW ≈ 12-15 panels)
solar._count_help: Number of solar arrays. Total peak = unit_peak_power_kw × count. Increase if system has high energy deficit

inverter._unit_max_output_kw_help: Maximum output per inverter in kW (clips excess solar generation)
inverter._count_help: Number of inverter units. Total max output = unit_max_output_kw × count
inverter._failure_rate_help: Daily failure probability as decimal (0.005 = 0.5% per day, 0.01 = 1%)
inverter._min_failure_duration_hours_help: Minimum hours inverter stays failed when failure occurs
inverter._max_failure_duration_hours_help: Maximum hours inverter stays failed (72h = 3 days)

load._base_load_kw_help: Constant base load in kW (refrigerator, router, standby devices)
load._peak_hours_max_kw_help: Maximum additional load during peak hours (cooking, entertainment)
load._peak_hours_start_help: Start of evening peak demand, hour 0-23 (18 = 6 PM)
load._peak_hours_end_help: End of evening peak demand, hour 0-23 (21 = 9 PM)

grid._import_cost_per_kwh_help: Cost to import energy from grid in $/kWh (0.0075 = 0.75 cents)
grid._export_revenue_per_kwh_help: Revenue from exporting energy to grid in $/kWh (0.009 = 0.9 cents)
grid._export_limit_kw_help: Maximum POWER (not energy) that can be exported to grid in kW. Acts as 'pipe size' limit

energy_management._strategy_help: Options: LOAD_PRIORITY (house first), CHARGE_PRIORITY (battery first), PRODUCE_PRIORITY (grid export first)

_example_1_small_house._description: Small house with deficit (like your current setup)

_tips._tip_1: Use random_seed for reproducible results: copy the 'actual_seed_used' from a previous run
_tips._tip_2: Increase time_step_minutes to 15 for more detailed data (4x more rows in CSV)
_tips._tip_3: If self-sufficiency < 50%, consider adding more batteries or solar panels
_tips._tip_4: Battery min_soc should be 0.05-0.1 (5-10%) to protect battery lifespan
_tips._tip_5: Inverter max_output should be slightly less than solar peak to prevent clipping losses
